commits.message: Update magic email login form styles
Adjust button styles
Add is-magic-login class
Add higher specificity for header css
Update width only for wpcom
Apply max width to different div
Merge branch 'update/magic-login-styling' into update/magic-login-confirmation

issue.title: Login: Update magic login confirmation styles

labels.name: [Status] Needs Review
labels.description: The PR is ready for review. This also triggers e2e canary tests and wp-desktop tests automatically.

labels.name: [Status] String Freeze
labels.description: Add the [Status] String Freeze label to your PR to ensure new strings are translated before merging

issue.body: ## Proposed Changes Updates styles of the magic email login confirmation screen (shows immediately after clicking send link from magic login page). Caveats: - Figma: 5p3iZ99zPYfl6ronoTYEXO-fi-4_1291 - P2: p9Jlb4-9mo-p2 - Changes are based on this PR **which should be merged first**: https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/pull/83546 - Caveat: The width of the text area is narrower than in designs. Because same page structure is used by many pages, I think there is more complexity expanding the width only on this page, but not on others. - Caveat: The designs also have a new link for 'I didn't receive my email'. I'm going to add that in a separate follow up PR. **Before** **After** ## Testing Instructions * ## Pre-merge Checklist - [ ] Has the general commit checklist been followed? (PCYsg-hS-p2) - [ ] https://wpcalypso.wordpress.com/devdocs/docs/testing/index.md for your changes? - [ ] Have you tested the feature in Simple (P9HQHe-k8-p2), Atomic (P9HQHe-jW-p2), and self-hosted Jetpack sites (PCYsg-g6b-p2)? - [ ] Have you checked for TypeScript, React or other console errors? - [ ] Have you used memoizing on expensive computations? More info in [Memoizing with create-selector](https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/trunk/packages/state-utils/src/create-selector/README.md) and [Using memoizing selectors](https://react-redux.js.org/api/hooks#using-memoizing-selectors) and [Our Approach to Data](https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/trunk/docs/our-approach-to-data.md) - [ ] Have we added the "[Status] String Freeze" label as soon as any new strings were ready for translation (p4TIVU-5Jq-p2)? - [ ] For changes affecting Jetpack: Have we added the "[Status] Needs Privacy Updates" label if this pull request changes what data or activity we track or use (p4TIVU-ajp-p2)?

comment.body: Rebased especially to have related PR https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/pull/83581 in the branch.

issue.title: Login: Update magic login form styles

labels.name: [Status] Needs Review
labels.description: The PR is ready for review. This also triggers e2e canary tests and wp-desktop tests automatically.

labels.name: [Status] String Freeze
labels.description: Add the [Status] String Freeze label to your PR to ensure new strings are translated before merging

issue.body: ## Proposed Changes Updates text/styles for the magic email form login. - An important consideration is that these changes be safe and limited to the specific situations we want. In this case, these changes should only affect the magic email login page, and only on wpcom (not jetpack or gravatar, which have different styling). - Figma: 5p3iZ99zPYfl6ronoTYEXO-fi-4_1291 - P2: p9Jlb4-9mo-p2 With changes, form now looks like this on desktop: And on mobile: ## Testing Instructions **Test the expected changes** * In an incognito or non-logged-in browser, go to wordpress.com and click the Login link. * From the login page, click 'Email me a login link' to go to the magic email login page * Replace wordpress.com with http://calypso.localhost:3000 to load this branch's version of the screen * Confirm that the styling matches the screenshot above * Using your browser tools, adjust the window to mobil size, and confirm styling on mobil looks like above * Add an email, click the button, and confirm the functionality works as before **Test there are not changes where there should not be** * Again incognito or non-logged-in browser, go to gravatar.com, click Login, and click the email login link. Again replace wordpress.com with http://calypso.localhost:3000 and confirm the gravatar email login page loads as it did before and is not affected by these changes. * There appears to be a magic email long for jetpack, but I was unable to figure how to access that. * If you know of any other flows that use magic email login, test those as well. ## Pre-merge Checklist - [ ] Has the general commit checklist been followed? (PCYsg-hS-p2) - [ ] https://wpcalypso.wordpress.com/devdocs/docs/testing/index.md for your changes? - [ ] Have you tested the feature in Simple (P9HQHe-k8-p2), Atomic (P9HQHe-jW-p2), and self-hosted Jetpack sites (PCYsg-g6b-p2)? - [ ] Have you checked for TypeScript, React or other console errors? - [ ] Have you used memoizing on expensive computations? More info in [Memoizing with create-selector](https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/trunk/packages/state-utils/src/create-selector/README.md) and [Using memoizing selectors](https://react-redux.js.org/api/hooks#using-memoizing-selectors) and [Our Approach to Data](https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/trunk/docs/our-approach-to-data.md) - [ ] Have we added the "[Status] String Freeze" label as soon as any new strings were ready for translation (p4TIVU-5Jq-p2)? - [ ] For changes affecting Jetpack: Have we added the "[Status] Needs Privacy Updates" label if this pull request changes what data or activity we track or use (p4TIVU-ajp-p2)?

- revise steps to be compatible with updated handlling of quote entry.
- type in the quote instead of fill.

packages/calypso-e2e/src/lib/blocks/paragraph-block.ts
- optional parameter "type" that uses the type method instead of fill.

Jetpack Manage: Update the Boost premium feature list (#82985)

* Update the boost feature list

* Add the premium badge

* Allow LicenseLightbox to accept className as props

* Remove an item from Boost as it is redundant

* Remove the Premium label from the list of features and fix typo

* Show PREMIUM label only when user clicks the Get Score
Use more specific selectors to avoid issues due to CSS load order (#83521)

issue.title: Added redirection when the token from the email is expired for non-wpcom users

labels.name: [Status] Needs Review
labels.description: The PR is ready for review. This also triggers e2e canary tests and wp-desktop tests automatically.

labels.name: [Feature] Subscriptions
labels.description: All subscription-related things such as paid and unpaid, user management, and newsletter settings.

milestone.title: Subscription Management: Seamless Email to WPCOM Subscriber Migration

issue.body: ## Proposed Changes When the non-WPCom user clicks on Confirm Subscription and Manage Subscriptions, and the token is expired, we need to show a different screen than the "Loggin link expired". Additionally, when the user clicks on the "try again" button, a different endpoint should be called (one for re-sending the email with the magic signup link). ## Testing Instructions ### Subscription Confirmation email 1. Apply this PR and start the application. 2. Go to a blog and subscribe with an email that doesn't have a WPCom account associated. 3. Go to your inbox and copy the link of the "Confirm now" button. 4. Check the link. There is a redirect_to parameter. Copy that URL. It should have this format: `wordpress.com/log-in/link/use?token=xxxxxx&email=xxxxx&client_id=xxxxx&redirect_to=xxxxxx&transition=true` (yes, it has another redirect_to inside). 5. Change `wordpress.com` for `calypso.localhost:3000` in that URL. 6. Go to the file `client/state/login/magic-login/actions.js` and change the line 77 from `token,` to `token: 'xxx'`. This way we are going to simulate the token is expired. 7. Open an incognito window and paste the URL you modified in the 5th step. 8. You should see the token expired screen: 9. Click on the `Try again` button. 10. Check your inbox. You should have a new link with a refreshed token. Copy the link. 11. Paste the link into an incognito window, and it should confirm the subscription correctly (you would want to check the subscriber's page of that blog and see if your email is there now). ### Subscription Manager email 1. Apply this PR and start the application. 2. Go to `https://wordpress.com/email-subscriptions`. Write your email and press enter. 3. Go to your inbox and copy the link of the "Manage Subscriptions" button. 4. Check the link. There is a redirect_to parameter. Copy that URL. It should have this format: `https://wordpress.com/log-in/link/use?token=xxxx&email=xxxx&client_id=xxxxx&redirect_to=xxxxxx&transition=true` (yes, this one has another redirect_to inside too). 5. Change `wordpress.com` for `calypso.localhost:3000` in that URL. 6. Go to the file `client/state/login/magic-login/actions.js` and change the line 77 from `token,` to `token: 'xxx'`. This way we are going to simulate the token is expired. 7. Open an incognito window and paste the URL you modified in the 5th step. 8. You should see the token expired screen: 9. Click on the `Try again` button. 10. Check your inbox. You should have a new link with a refreshed token. Copy the link. 11. Paste the link into an incognito window, and it should take you to your subscriptions screen. ### **Regression test** 1. Go to `calypso.localhost:3000` in an incognito window in the browser. 2. Click `Log in to WordPress.com`. 3. Click `Email me a login link`. 4. Insert there the email of a WPCom account and click `Get link`. 5. Go to your inbox, copy the link in the action button on the email, and change `wordpress.com` to `calypso.localhost:3000` in that link. 6. Paste the link in an incognito window. It should proceed as normal. ## Pre-merge Checklist - [ ] Has the general commit checklist been followed? (PCYsg-hS-p2) - [ ] https://wpcalypso.wordpress.com/devdocs/docs/testing/index.md for your changes? - [ ] Have you tested the feature in Simple (P9HQHe-k8-p2), Atomic (P9HQHe-jW-p2), and self-hosted Jetpack sites (PCYsg-g6b-p2)? - [ ] Have you checked for TypeScript, React or other console errors? - [ ] Have you used memoizing on expensive computations? More info in [Memoizing with create-selector](https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/trunk/packages/state-utils/src/create-selector/README.md) and [Using memoizing selectors](https://react-redux.js.org/api/hooks#using-memoizing-selectors) and [Our Approach to Data](https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/trunk/docs/our-approach-to-data.md) - [ ] Have we added the "[Status] String Freeze" label as soon as any new strings were ready for translation (p4TIVU-5Jq-p2)? - [ ] For changes affecting Jetpack: Have we added the "[Status] Needs Privacy Updates" label if this pull request changes what data or activity we track or use (p4TIVU-ajp-p2)?

comment.body:
> Nice job @JuanLucha! I only noticed that the Welcome Back page is displayed quickly before the expired login page. Not sure if it's possible on the current structure, but would be nice to skip the Welcome Back rendering.

You are right! I have uploaded a new version with some checks to avoid that blinking of the welcoming message. Thanks for the review!

commits.message: No Welcome message blink on expired token with magic login link

issue.title: Update Calypso to Node 20

labels.name: [Status] Needs Review
labels.description: The PR is ready for review. This also triggers e2e canary tests and wp-desktop tests automatically.

labels.name: [Type] Tooling
labels.description: Related to tools, scripts, automation, DevX, etc.

issue.body: This supersedes #81798. We had to revert that PR due to a unit test failure which appeared on trunk. We didn't catch it in our branch due to an oversight with our unit test setup. (The specific change in this branch compared to the original PR is https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/pull/83585/commits/c5c1d64a4290b41f27313033ebfc9726b60eb29b) The only reason we had to revert was https://github.com/tschaub/mock-fs/issues/380, which is that certain Node FS methods don't get mocked properly with the `mock-fs` package under node 20. A small manual mock seems to fix the issue. The specific reason that the unit tests build is because of our base image setup. This base image is rebuilt twice per day, and includes all the binaries and tools for building and testing Calypso. As a result, this contains the Node image. Therefore, the _branch_ unit test build points at the _current_ "latest" base image, which does not include Node 20. Once we merged the PR, and run the "base image" build, then the latest base image includes "node 20." After that, every build started using the new Node version, including unit tests. While we tested a few builds (such as calypso.live) using a test base image which included Node 20, we didn't do that for the unit tests. There is definitely room for improvement with how we test these PRs, but here's what we can do now: - Use our existing test base image (with the tag `test-node-20`) - Manually run a unit test build pointing to this tag and branch

comment.body:
I manually triggered several builds using the node 20 base image:
- docker image build with node 20: https://teamcity.a8c.com/buildConfiguration/calypso_BuildDockerImage/11095884
- unit test build : https://teamcity.a8c.com/buildConfiguration/calypso_calypso_WebApp_Run_All_Unit_Tests/11095889
- lint: https://teamcity.a8c.com/buildConfiguration/calypso_calypso_WebApp_Check_Code_Style_Branch/11095906
- desktop e2e: https://teamcity.a8c.com/buildConfiguration/calypso_calypso_WebApp_Calypso_E2E_Playwright_desktop/11095920

review.body: I like it! Mostly nits. Only one tracking bug.

pull_request.title: Add/app promo to login link
pull_request.body: Before: After: iPhone Android ## Proposed Changes * This Pr adds the app promo banner to the email me a login link pages. ## Testing Instructions * Load this PR. * Navigate to /log-in/link * Notice the new banner. Make sure that it works as expected (responsive, loaded as an iPhone and Android) You should only see the app store button. * Enter a valid email. Notice that the "Check your email" page also has the app banner. * Visit /home/example.com notice that the admin bar looks and works as before. * Visit /me/get-apps notice that it works as before. * visit /devdocs/blocks/app-promo notice the app banner works as before. ## Pre-merge Checklist - [ ] Has the general commit checklist been followed? (PCYsg-hS-p2) - [ ] https://wpcalypso.wordpress.com/devdocs/docs/testing/index.md for your changes? - [ ] Have you tested the feature in Simple (P9HQHe-k8-p2), Atomic (P9HQHe-jW-p2), and self-hosted Jetpack sites (PCYsg-g6b-p2)? - [ ] Have you checked for TypeScript, React or other console errors? - [ ] Have you used memoizing on expensive computations? More info in [Memoizing with create-selector](https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/trunk/packages/state-utils/src/create-selector/README.md) and [Using memoizing selectors](https://react-redux.js.org/api/hooks#using-memoizing-selectors) and [Our Approach to Data](https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/trunk/docs/our-approach-to-data.md) - [ ] Have we added the "[Status] String Freeze" label as soon as any new strings were ready for translation (p4TIVU-5Jq-p2)? - [ ] For changes affecting Jetpack: Have we added the "[Status] Needs Privacy Updates" label if this pull request changes what data or activity we track or use (p4TIVU-ajp-p2)?

issue.title: Update Calypso to Node 20

labels.name: [Status] Needs Review
labels.description: The PR is ready for review. This also triggers e2e canary tests and wp-desktop tests automatically.

labels.name: [Type] Tooling
labels.description: Related to tools, scripts, automation, DevX, etc.

issue.body: This supersedes #81798. We had to revert that PR due to a unit test failure which appeared on trunk. We didn't catch it in our branch due to an oversight with our unit test setup. (The specific change in this branch compared to the original PR is https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/pull/83585/commits/c5c1d64a4290b41f27313033ebfc9726b60eb29b) The only reason we had to revert was https://github.com/tschaub/mock-fs/issues/380, which is that certain Node FS methods don't get mocked properly with the `mock-fs` package under node 20. A small manual mock seems to fix the issue. The specific reason that the unit tests build is because of our base image setup. This base image is rebuilt twice per day, and includes all the binaries and tools for building and testing Calypso. As a result, this contains the Node image. Therefore, the _branch_ unit test build points at the _current_ "latest" base image, which does not include Node 20. Once we merged the PR, and run the "base image" build, then the latest base image includes "node 20." After that, every build started using the new Node version, including unit tests. While we tested a few builds (such as calypso.live) using a test base image which included Node 20, we didn't do that for the unit tests. There is definitely room for improvement with how we test these PRs, but here's what we can do now: - Use our existing test base image (with the tag `test-node-20`) - Manually run a unit test build pointing to this tag and branch

issue.title: Update Calypso to Node 20

labels.name: [Status] Needs Review
labels.description: The PR is ready for review. This also triggers e2e canary tests and wp-desktop tests automatically.

labels.name: [Type] Tooling
labels.description: Related to tools, scripts, automation, DevX, etc.

issue.body: This supersedes #81798. We had to revert that PR due to a unit test failure which appeared on trunk. We didn't catch it in our branch due to an oversight with our unit test setup. The only reason we had to revert was https://github.com/tschaub/mock-fs/issues/380, which is that certain Node FS methods don't get mocked properly with the `mock-fs` package under node 20. A small manual mock seems to fix the issue. The specific reason that the unit tests build is because of our base image setup. This base image is rebuilt twice per day, and includes all the binaries and tools for building and testing Calypso. As a result, this contains the Node image. Therefore, the _branch_ unit test build points at the _current_ "latest" base image, which does not include Node 20. Once we merged the PR, and run the "base image" build, then the latest base image includes "node 20." After that, every build started using the new Node version, including unit tests. While we tested a few builds (such as calypso.live) using a test base image which included Node 20, we didn't do that for the unit tests. There is definitely room for improvement with how we test these PRs, but here's what we can do now: - Use our existing test base image (with the tag `test-node-20`) - Manually run a unit test build pointing to this tag and branch

The only reason we had to revert was https://github.com/tschaub/mock-fs/issues/380, which is that certain Node FS methods don't get mocked properly with the `mock-fs` package under node 20. A small manual mock seems to fix the issue. The specific reason that the unit tests build is because of our base image setup. This base image is rebuilt twice per day, and includes all the binaries and tools for building and testing Calypso. As a result, this contains the Node image. Therefore, the _branch_ unit test build points at the _current_ "latest" base image, which does not include Node 20. Once we merged the PR, and run the "base image" build, then the latest base image includes "node 20." After that, every build started using the new Node version, including unit tests. While we tested a few builds (such as calypso.live) using a test base image which included Node 20, we didn't do that for the unit tests. There is definitely room for improvement with how we test these PRs, but here's what we can do now: - Use our existing test base image (with the tag `test-node-20`) - Manually run a unit test build pointing to this tag and branch

pull_request.title: FoldableCard to packages (Step 2): Temporarily shim old Calypso FoldableCard component
pull_request.body: Related to https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/issues/78992 Branched from https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/pull/83231 ## Proposed Changes - We point the old `FoldableCard` component to the new one in `@automattic/components`, allowing us to transition from the old code to the new in smaller pieces and without risking updates to the old component in the interim. - Remove old docs and files ## Testing Instructions Test instances of the `FoldableCard` component in Calypso. Examples: - `/plans/[ site ]` and `/start/plans` pages in mobile: - `/setup/hundred-year-plan` - `/export/[ site ]` ## Pre-merge Checklist - [ ] Has the general commit checklist been followed? (PCYsg-hS-p2) - [ ] https://wpcalypso.wordpress.com/devdocs/docs/testing/index.md for your changes? - [ ] Have you tested the feature in Simple (P9HQHe-k8-p2), Atomic (P9HQHe-jW-p2), and self-hosted Jetpack sites (PCYsg-g6b-p2)? - [ ] Have you checked for TypeScript, React or other console errors? - [ ] Have you used memoizing on expensive computations? More info in [Memoizing with create-selector](https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/trunk/packages/state-utils/src/create-selector/README.md) and [Using memoizing selectors](https://react-redux.js.org/api/hooks#using-memoizing-selectors) and [Our Approach to Data](https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/trunk/docs/our-approach-to-data.md) - [ ] Have we added the "[Status] String Freeze" label as soon as any new strings were ready for translation (p4TIVU-5Jq-p2)? - [ ] For changes affecting Jetpack: Have we added the "[Status] Needs Privacy Updates" label if this pull request changes what data or activity we track or use (p4TIVU-ajp-p2)?

issue.title: Login: Update magic login form styles

issue.body: ## Proposed Changes Updates text/styles for the magic email form login. - An important consideration is that these changes be safe and limited to the specific situations we want. In this case, these changes should only affect the magic email login page, and only on wpcom (not jetpack or gravatar, which have different styling). - Figma: 5p3iZ99zPYfl6ronoTYEXO-fi-4_1291 - P2: p9Jlb4-9mo-p2 With changes, form now looks like this on desktop: And on mobile: ## Testing Instructions **Test the expected changes** * In an incognito or non-logged-in browser, go to wordpress.com and click the Login link. * From the login page, click 'Email me a login link' to go to the magic email login page * Replace wordpress.com with http://calypso.localhost:3000 to load this branch's version of the screen * Confirm that the styling matches the screenshot above * Using your browser tools, adjust the window to mobil size, and confirm styling on mobil looks like above * Add an email, click the button, and confirm the functionality works as before **Test there are not changes where there should not be** * Again incognito or non-logged-in browser, go to gravatar.com, click Login, and click the email login link. Again replace wordpress.com with http://calypso.localhost:3000 and confirm the gravatar email login page loads as it did before and is not affected by these changes. * There appears to be a magic email long for jetpack, but I was unable to figure how to access that. * If you know of any other flows that use magic email login, test those as well. ## Pre-merge Checklist - [ ] Has the general commit checklist been followed? (PCYsg-hS-p2) - [ ] https://wpcalypso.wordpress.com/devdocs/docs/testing/index.md for your changes? - [ ] Have you tested the feature in Simple (P9HQHe-k8-p2), Atomic (P9HQHe-jW-p2), and self-hosted Jetpack sites (PCYsg-g6b-p2)? - [ ] Have you checked for TypeScript, React or other console errors? - [ ] Have you used memoizing on expensive computations? More info in [Memoizing with create-selector](https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/trunk/packages/state-utils/src/create-selector/README.md) and [Using memoizing selectors](https://react-redux.js.org/api/hooks#using-memoizing-selectors) and [Our Approach to Data](https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/trunk/docs/our-approach-to-data.md) - [ ] Have we added the "[Status] String Freeze" label as soon as any new strings were ready for translation (p4TIVU-5Jq-p2)? - [ ] For changes affecting Jetpack: Have we added the "[Status] Needs Privacy Updates" label if this pull request changes what data or activity we track or use (p4TIVU-ajp-p2)?

comment.body: I've reviewed the magic links for WP.com and Jetpack in the production environment. It seems that Jetpack's magic login largely leverages WP.com's design, as indicated below. If this is the case, our primary task for this PR might be to differentiate the design from Gravatar. 😉 | WP.com | Jetpack | | - | - | | | |

issue.title: Improve Social Signup: Send directly to password if existing email
issue.body:
## Current

Visit `https://wordpress.com/start/user-social`, insert an already existing email.
You will see an error message, and if you click on `Log in now`, you will be redirected to the log-in page.

## Now

With this PR, if the email already exists, when the user inserts the email and clicks, it gets directly redirected to the log-in page. We show the user a notice.

We excluded passwordless accounts in this PR (no reason to send them to password..)

Added `error_code` (can be 'already_taken', 'already_active', 'email_exists' or others) to `calypso_signup_actions_onboarding_passwordless_login_error` event.

## Why

If the user inserts an existing email, it's clear the intent to use that to enter WordPress.com. We should remove friction when it is possible.


https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/assets/17054134/6f61ec64-084a-488f-b3d6-9d2fae8ebed8



## Testing

1. Live Link
2. Visit `/start`
3. Click Email and insert an existing email
4. Click on `Continue`
5. You should land in /log-in with the ability to directly insert the password. You should also see a notice.
6. Check for translations.

comment.body:
This Pull Request is now available for translation here: https://translate.wordpress.com/deliverables/9519998

Some locales (Hebrew, Japanese) have been temporarily machine-translated due to translator availability. All other translations are usually ready within a few days. Untranslated and machine-translated strings will be sent for translation next Monday and are expected to be completed by the following Friday.

Hi @escapemanuele, could you please edit the description of this PR and add a screenshot for our translators? Ideally it'd include all of the following strings:
- `Log in to your existing account`
- `This email address is already associated with an account. Please consider {{returnToSignup}}using another one{{/returnToSignup}} or log in.`

Thank you in advance!

issue.title: The file size is always shown as zero for videos uploaded to media on video details

labels.name: [Feature] Media
labels.description: The media screen in Calypso, general media management, or integration with third party media.

labels.name: [Feature] VideoPress
labels.description: A feature to help you upload and insert videos on your site.

labels.name: Triaged
labels.description: To be used when issues have been triaged.

labels.name: [Product] WordPress.com
labels.description: All features accessible on and related to WordPress.com.

labels.name: [Feature Group] Content Management
labels.description: Features related to the tools and screens that admins use to manage their sites core content.

issue.body: ### Quick summary The file size of videos uploaded to the WordPress.com atomic sites media (business and eCommerce plans) is always shown as zero in the video details even though the file size for those videos is greater than zero (WordPress.com dashboard -> media -> videos -> select video -> edit -> scroll and find the video file size). I reproduced this bug on the atomic site www.cursatica.com and attached a screenshot. The bug happens to every video uploaded the same way to that site. You can reach out to @danielbachhuber for more technical details since we went together through a support session, and he could verify the bug in that site. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Go to an Atomic WordPress.com website (You can use the www.cursatica.com atomic site to verify the issue) 2. Go to the WordPress dashboard and select media. 3. Select a video and edit it 4. Check the video file size. It is shown as zero. (See the screenshot in the issue description.) ### What you expected to happen I expected the file size of the video to be shown in the video details (select the video on the media tab and click edit for the video details to appear) once the video was fully uploaded to the media. Still, I saw the file size to be zero for all videos uploaded when those videos have a considerable file size. ### What actually happened The video file size was always shown as zero for all the videos uploaded to the site. ### Impact One ### Available workarounds? No but the platform is still usable ### Platform (Simple and/or Atomic) Atomic ### Logs or notes _No response_

comment.body: > can you weigh in here - is the 0,00 B file size expected, given the VideoPress feature on AT? I'd say it's not expected, no; it should be displayed properly. That said, I cannot even to the screen y'all see on your sites. I don't have any "file size" info on my end: That may be the expected behavior: https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/f2e6f88ae65c8571bbac21b284c29b48ec987598/client/post-editor/media-modal/detail/detail-file-info.jsx#L80-L85 Could you try to open your browser's network tools (Cmd+Opt+E in Firefox), and filter for "XHR" and `videos/`: Then open the media and inspect the request that is fired: You'll be looking at info about the file size in there.
